title: Mineral wealth
creator_contributor_role: Australian National Film Board, production company
subject_group: Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Mineral industries - Australia - History
Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Mines and mineral resources - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Wealth - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Mining districts - Social aspects
description: Survey of mineral wealth in Australia today. Raw materials mined, refined and processed in Australia include silver, lead, zinc, copper, iron ore, bauxite, uranium and coal. Shows typical mining towns, Broken Hill, Mt Isa, Mary Kathleen, Rum Jungle, Weipa, Yampi Sound and in the Latrobe Valley; and production and refining centres - Port Kembla, Cocklecreek and Bell Bay.
